intro: Brunellia littlei subsp. littlei, commonly known as the Little's Brunellia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, specifically found in the islands of Hispaniola and Cuba. This evergreen shrub or small tree typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. It is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink. The plant produces woody capsules as fruit, containing numerous seeds.
